rdf:Description.dbpedia-owl:abstract: Robin Fulton (born 18 August 1937 on the Isle of Arran), is a Scottish poet and translator. He has lived in Stavanger, Norway, since 1973 working as a university lecturer- Fulton holds a PhD from Edinburgh University. He has published own collections and several translations of Scandinavian poetry into English, e.g. Olav H. Hauge, Tomas Tranströmer and Henrik Nordbrandt.
rdf:Description.foaf:name: Robin Fulton
